result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirk P. Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Injury/Operate-Control. Substance (2+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances, alcohol or drug paraphernalia including syringes w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 24 hours if one is received.  Absolute sobriety at all times. Random UAs.  No contact w/A.P., D.R., R.C., C.C. or any other drug dealers known to agent.  Not to go upon premises of Malibu Inn.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Both parties recv'd and read PSI.  Atty. Christian makes corrections of PSI.  State gives recommendation.  Atty. Christian gives recommendation.  DE makes statement.  Court imposes sentence.

Sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Kirk P. Knight in court with attorney David L. Christian.  Defendant Kirk P. Knight in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states the Counts DE will be plead to/dismissed but read in.  Atty Christian agrees.  NCP entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. finds Def. guilty on Count 2.  Counts 1, 3, 4-5 - Dismissed but read in.  Counsel request a PSI.  Courts orders a PSI to be completed by no later than August 1, 2022, and matter will be set for argued sentence.  Bond is revoked pending sentencing.
Plea hearing on April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:13 PM Defendant Kirk P. Knight in court with attorney David L. Christian.  Defendant Kirk P. Knight in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes ARGN in 3 cases and one set for RD is 21CF642.  Atty Christian states all matters are nearly resolved - needs time to work out minor details.  Requests all matters be set over to 4/22/22 at 11:30 in another matter.  Court sets 21CF642 on 4/22/22 at 11:00 a.m. for WP.  22CF17 - Court proceeds w/arraignment.  Atty Christian acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Christian stands mute to charges in 22CF17.  22CF21 - Court proceeds w/ARGN.  Atty Chrisitan acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Christian stands mute to charges in 22CF21.  22CF22 - Court proceeds to ARGN.   Atty Chrisitan acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Christian stands mute to charges in 22CF22.  Court enters NG pleas to all charges in 22CF17, 22CF21 and 22CF22.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.  21CF110 is also reset to 4/22/22 at 11:00 a.m.  21CF71 to track also.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:39 PM Defendant Kirk P. Knight in court with attorney David L. Christian, both by video.  Defendant Kirk P. Knight in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  DE rec'd complaints in 22CF17, 22CF21 and 22CF22.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in all 3 cases.  Court finds the complaints in those 3 matters establish probable cause.  In 22CF17 and 22CF22 - State requests $100,000 cash and then requests $5,000 cash in each of the other 4 cases.  Atty Christian responds/requests signature bonds.  Court sets bonds of $20,000 cash in each case.  Atty Christian requests PH be set as early as conveniently possible.  Court discusses.  Court finds DE does not waive his time limits in 22CF17, 22CF21 and 22CF22.  Prelims set in those 3 matters.

21CF71 - $20,000 cash bond set - Plea/sent 2/21/22 at 1pm
21CF110 - $20,000 cash bond set - Will be placed back on the JT calendar
21CF642 - $20,000 cash bond set - Plea/sent 2/21/22 at 1pm
22CF17 - $20,000 cash bond set - Prelim on 1/20/22 at 10:15 a.m. in Br 3
22CF21 - $20,000 cash bond set - Prelim on 1/20/22 at 10:15 a.m. in Br 3
22CF22 - $20,000 cash bond set - Prelim on 1/20/22 at 10:15 a.m. in Br 3

Conditions of bond in ALL six cases:
Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received it must be maintained in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Not to operate a MV with any alcohol or controlled substances on board.  If requested by law enforcement DE must submit to chemical testing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
